channel.title: Why use an Anti-Leech?
channel.description:
The question that I ask and I'm sure many other people do as well, why would someone put an Anti-Leech on their server, that they are releasing?
When you release your server on the Moparscape forums for people to download, you should expect them to want to change things up, and you should want them too as well. With an Anti-Leech however, it just doesn't work. I understand that people want to protect their work because they are proud of it, but there is a serious problem with that.
With an Anti-Leech in main files such as client.java or a packet file, people cannot change the name of the server because you can't compile. If the server cannot be re-named, there will be tons and tons of that server with your name, and people pretending to be you all over the internet.
I will give a 100% fictional example:
So billy releases his server called RobertoScape, but he has an anti-leech on it. When billy puts his server in the moparscape downloads section with all of it's cool features and pictures in the post with a download link, people want it and download it. When they download it, they realize "Oh yeah, he put an anti-leech in this" so they keep the name RobertoScape. Billy is already running RobertoScape on his computer and then he goes to check a status page too see it's uptime and then sees that "HOLY SH*T! There are a million RobertoScapes now!" all of those servers had to keep it's original name though because of billy's anti-leech.
Now of course people can always by-pass an anti-leech by looking for incorrect coding throughout the files, but that is time consuming and depending on how sophisticated the anti-leech is, may take some skill.
I'm not saying that people shouldn't be proud of their work, but I'm saying if you don't want people to steal your source, or your afraid of leechers, then don't post it in server downloads with download links, advertise it somewhere.
Now this may get locked, but I did post this in general chat so if it does, I don't know.
Thank you for reading, I would like to know how you guys feel about this so feel free to leave a comment.

item.title: Why use an Anti-Leech?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Chassy13:

So idiots can’t leech it by changing the name and releasing it.

Yeah, that sums it up.

Read full topic

Btw anti-leech is there so people can’t leech, Thats why its called “anti-LEECH” obviousally.

Read full topic

item.title: Why use an Anti-Leech?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

So when someone who doesn’t know anything about Java downloads it, they don’t have the right to change the name etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Why use an Anti-Leech?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“quest rs, post:7, topic:295589”][quote author=ktdude41994 link=topic=391578.msg2916166#msg2916166 date=1250456221]
Haha, I understand the whole releasing issue, but do you want multiple people opening your servers, claiming they are original, and pretending to be you?
[/quote]

if you’re smart… you will know how to avoid that. Trust me, literally about 50% of the moparscapians don’t even know what Int means. What a class is, or hell what OOP even is.[/quote]

int = interger , Object Oriented Programming, class can be in OOP, or as in class YourClass {

Chassy13:

So idiots can’t leech it by changing the name and releasing it.

People or Leechers. Post on Server Help Section. How Do I Remove It And Everyone Help…

item.title: Why use an Anti-Leech?
item.dc:creator: @ktdude41994 ktdude41994
item.description:
@ktdude41994 wrote:

I have made my own. None that I have released. The ones that I released I did leech (Was a long time ago) and then people got mad and when I made my own server, I didn’t release it because I didn’t want people like my old self, to do what I did. I just like to look at new servers that are released and I always see “ANTI-LEECH” posted in big red bold letters.

Read full topic

item.title: Why use an Anti-Leech?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Make your own server and you wouldn’t have to worry about ‘anti-leech’.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

Chassy13:

So idiots can’t leech it by changing the name and releasing it.

Can I kiss you for explaining it in just 12 words and a period?

Old Rsc Player:

Well I agree, but then there will be a ton of one server floating around status pages claiming to be the original.

There is no such thing as originality when it comes to 13 year olds dreaming to become the next Andrew Gower, with a better server than rs… What they don’t realize is, that it will never happen until they write their own god damn engine, and come up with an original game.
